intro: Agalinis tenuifolia, commonly known as slenderstem false foxglove, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as prairies and woodland edges. It produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. Its life cycle is adapted to seasonal fluctuations, with flowering occurring primarily in late summer to early fall.
